other_tests.findings: Cytologic examination showed rare reactive epithelial cells, acute and chronic inflammation, and no malignant cells.

Revealed a diffusely dilated biliary tree above a localized 10-mm-long stenosis of the middle third of the common bile duct. A sphincterotomy was performed, and afterward a stent was placed with bile flow seen through the stent.
other_tests.changes_over_time: ERCP showed a persistent stricture of the middle third of the main bile duct and a patent sphincterotomy; cytologic analysis of bile-duct brushings was negative for malignant cells.

other_tests.date: Three weeks later after initial hospitalization
other_tests.findings: Revealed necrotizing granulomatous inflammation in soft tissue; no pancreatic tissue was identified. Cytologic examination showed rare atypical epithelial cells, acute inflammation, multinucleated giant cells, and epithelioid histiocytes forming vague granulomas.

other_tests.procedure_name: Excisional biopsy of paraduodenal and periportal lymph nodes
other_tests.findings: Showed a necrotizing granulomatous lymphadenitis, with cultures yielding growth of M. tuberculosis.
